title: Fix live tracking flow and persist food posts so Track works in production

requirements.text: Make the 'Track' button on the NGO Alert screen perform a real action by navigating to a dedicated tracking view (new route) that displays the current pickup/tracking status for the most recent food post.

quotes: track system is not working live

acceptanceCriteria: On /ngo-alert, clicking the 'Track' button navigates to a tracking view (e.g., /track) instead of doing nothing.
The tracking view renders without errors in production builds and shows a clear status timeline/steps (e.g., 'Request received' -> 'Driver assigned' -> 'On the way' -> 'Arrived').

If there is a most recent food post, the tracking view includes its title/quantity/date/time; if not, it shows an English empty-state message prompting the user to add a food post first and provides a button to navigate to Add Food.

requirements.text: Persist the client-side food posts store so that History, NGO Alert, and the new tracking view continue to work after a page refresh in the live/production environment.

quotes: track system is not working live

acceptanceCriteria: After posting a food item, refreshing the page keeps the item visible in the History screen.
After posting a food item, refreshing the page keeps the most recent post available to the NGO Alert screen (mostRecent is not lost due to in-memory reset).
Persistence uses browser storage only (no external database) and does not require backend changes.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn components are read-only).
Do not edit immutable hook files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
nonGoals: Do not implement real GPS, live maps, or real-time vehicle location updates.
Do not add third-party map integrations or external APIs.
Do not add non-Internet-Computer authentication providers.
